intro: Calligonum gobicum, commonly known as the Gobi spurge, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by small, spherical fruits. It is well adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Calligonum gobicum plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion in its native habitat.
